nodes.title: Fanhackers
nodes.content:
Organization for Transformative Works (OTW) fan studies outreach
project.

nodes.title: Fujoshi Info
nodes.content: Fandom research hub for Anglophones on BL, Yuri and more.

nodes.title: Anna's Archive
nodes.content: Yohoho and a bottle of rum.

nodes.title: Fanlore
Marxists Internet Archive
WikiFur
Disability Studies Quarterly
Acute Religious Experiences: Madness, Psychosis and Religious Studies
nodes.content: I'm curious how the concept of "acute religious experience" can be applied to political religions like white Supremacy.

nodes.title: Muscle Boys: Gay Gym Culture
Transformative Works and Cultures
Killer Fandom: Fan Studies and the Celebrity Serial Killer
nodes.content:
Serial killer fandoms may be comparable to far-right "spree killer
fandoms."

nodes.title: Textual Poachers: Television Fans and Participatory Culture
nodes.content: Seminal work in fan studies.

nodes.title: A Companion to Media Fandom and Fan Studies
Transformative Works and Cultures
First Monday
nodes.content: Compares the free labor of Fandom, Open Source Software and Social Media.

nodes.title: Internet Spaceships are Serious Business: An EVE Online Reader
Hypertext: Critical Theory and New Media in an Era of Globalization
nodes.content:
English professor, George Landow brings together post-structural
literary theory and the web.

nodes.title: Deconstruction·Derrida
nodes.content:
I hated this book. However, you need to understand some literary
theory to understand memes and shitposting.

nodes.title: Erotic Comics in Japan: An Introduction to Eromanga
nodes.content: Manga critic, Kaoru Nagayama studies the history of erotic manga.

nodes.title: The History of Hentai Manga: An Expressionist Examination of EroManga
nodes.content: Japanese media critic, Kimi Rito studies the evolution of the semiotics of hentai.

nodes.title: Japan Forum
nodes.content:
Lucid exploration of the "otoko no ko" subculture, sometimes vulgarly
referred to as "traps" on 4chan.

nodes.title: Journal of Anime and Manga Studies
Journal of Visual Culture
Post Memes: Seizing the Memes of Production
Social Media + Society
Otaku: Japan’s Database Animals
nodes.content:
Japanese cultural critic, Hiroki Azuma posits otaku culture as a
postmodern genre of media centered around the appreciation of the
schema or database of elements of a work rather than the narrative of
a work.  4chan is directly related to Japanese image board and otaku
culture.

See also for an explainer, Paul Perdijk's article on "Database
Consumption" in *Japanese Media and Popular Culture* at
[jmpc-utokyo.com/keyword/database-consumption](https://jmpc-utokyo.com/keyword/database-consumption).

nodes.title: Beautiful Fighting Girl
nodes.content:
Japanese Lacanian psychiatrist, Saitō Tamaki posits an emerging
postmodern archetype of the "phallic girl" central to a large amount
of otaku media.

nodes.title: Living in the Lap of the Goddess: The Feminist Spirituality Movement in America
Queens of the Wild: Pagan Goddesses in Christian Europe: An Investigation
The Triumph of the Moon: A History of Modern Pagan Witchcraft
nodes.content:
Discusses British Wicca origins and influences. Exhaustive and
fascinating but far too uncritical of right-wing currents within Wicca
and Wicca's Occultist influences. Good background for spiritual
eco-feminism and TERFism but does not discuss the subject.

nodes.title: Experimental Sound & Radio
nodes.content: Relevant to hypnosis porn.

nodes.title: The Color of Kink: Black Women, BDSM, and Pornography
nodes.content:
Ariane Cruz studies black women in kink.  4chan has a strange
relationship with raceplay.

nodes.title: Transgender Studies Quarterly
nodes.content:
PHD candidate, Aster Gilbert explores trans\* micropornography, so
basically /gif/.

nodes.title: International Journal of Sexuality and Gender Studies
Please Scream Quietly: A Story of Kink
The Black Body in Ecstasy: Reading Race, Reading Pornography
Asexualities: Feminist and Queer Perspectives
Devon Price
nodes.content: In this article, Dr. Devon Price confesses a fascinating description of asexual eroticism.

nodes.title: Hard Core: Power, Pleasure and the "Frenzy of the Visible"
nodes.content:
Film studies professor, Linda Williams analyzes hard-core film
pornography.

nodes.title: Black Theology & Black Power
nodes.content:
I consider white Supremacy to be a political religion and I think that
attempts to fight white Supremacy must include theology.

nodes.title: Signs
nodes.content:
Cameron Awkward-Rich discusses the contradictions between feminism and
trans studies.

nodes.title: TSQ: Transgender Studies Quarterly
nodes.content:
Andrea L. Chu and Emmet H. Drager criticize the state of trans studies
as reductively antinormative, and derivative of gender studies and
queer studies.  Chu and Drager posit the value of the transsexual
precisely in problematicizing antinormative narratives.

nodes.title: International Journal of Offender Therapy and Comparative Criminology
nodes.content:
Considers applying the social model of disability to pyschopathy. I
think similar questions can be asked of personality disorders,
right-wing authoritarianism, social-dominance orientation, the
authoritarian predisposition, protest whiteness and hypermasculinity.

nodes.title: Mad at School: Rhetorics of Mental Disability and Academic Life
nodes.content:
Analyzes the rhetoric of madness around school shootings. Internet
forums strike me as a kairotic space in the sense Price
discusses. Counter-strategic resistance and counter-diagnostic
strategies of incoherence and proliferation strike me as relevant to
chan culture. The whole rhetoric of facts and logic used in the right
is also relevant here.

nodes.title: Frontiers in Communication
Authoring Autism: On Rhetoric and Neurological Queerness
nodes.content:
Melanie Yergeau subverts rhetorical disability tropes. Good, but
written in an extremely academic style.

nodes.title: The Hidden Injuries of Class
Times Square Red, Times Square Blue
The Bully Society: School Shootings and the Crisis of Bullying in America’s Schools
The Protestant Ethic and the Spirit of Capitalism
One-Dimensional Man: Studies in the Ideology of Advanced Industrial Society
nodes.content:
I think the concept of "repressive desublimation" can be applied to
angst and self-destructive qualities. Much of the "alt-right" would
then be a kind of "McFascism", a quick and easy expression of misery
but not a real cartharsis or critique of the capitalist system.

nodes.title: Body Image in Eating Disorders: Clinical Diagnosis and Integrative Approach to Psychological Treatment
nodes.content:
Body image issues overlap with incel and redpiller body issues. More
generally, body image issues overlap with the bigorexia of the
far-right.

nodes.title: Looking Good: Male Body Image in Modern America
Invisible Lives: the Erasure of Transsexual and Transgendered People
Whipping Girl: A Transsexual Woman on Sexism and the Scapegoating of Femininity
Terror, Love and Brainwashing: Attachment in Cults and Totalitarian Systems
When Prophecy Fails: Social and Psychological Study of a Modern Group That Predicted the Destruction of the World
nodes.content: Quite flawed study.

nodes.title: The Wages of Whiteness: Race and the Making of the American Working Class
Settlers: The Mythology of the White Proletariat
Monopoly Capital: An Essay on the American Economic and Social Order
nodes.content:
The part on advertising as a way of absorbing the super-profits of
monopoly capital seems extremely relevant to the latest nonsense with
digital marketing (Google, Facebook, Twitter, etc...). I need to look
into *The New Industrial Society*.

nodes.title: Health Communism: A Surplus Manifesto
nodes.content:
Money model of disability makes a lot of sense but I need to
reread/finish up this one.

nodes.title: The Dangerous Class: The Cocnept of the Lumpenproletarit
The Black Masses
Masculinity and New War: The gendered dynamics of contemporary armed conflict
nodes.content:
Scholar of International Relations, David Duriesmith reexamines "new
war" as the adoption of protest masculinities in response to
breakdowns in patriarchal bargaining.

nodes.title: Empire of Normality: Neurodiversity and Capitalism
nodes.content: <!-- Philosopher, Robert Chapman ... -->

nodes.title: Social Reproduction Theory
nodes.content:
Explains a lot of gender war stuff like incels in reference to the
tension between economic production and social reproduction.
Basically, no one has the free time to have sex anymore.

nodes.title: Imperialism, the Highest Stage of Capitalism
Game Studies
Understanding and Treating Incels: Case Studies, Guidance, and Treatment of Violence Risk in the Involuntary Celibate Community
Incels and Ideologies: Exploring How Incels Use Language to Construct Gender and Race
Hypatia
nodes.content:
Dr. Filip Melo Lopes posits incel desire-hatred ambivalence in terms
of Beauvoir's sovereign subject (Beauvoir).  Lopes focuses on Elliot Rodger, and
addresses incel sadism, but does not address incel masochism.

nodes.title: The Incel Rebellion: The Rise of the Manosphere and the Virtual War Against Women
On Microfascism: Gender, War, and Death
nodes.content:
Essentially describes fascism as a belief in palingenetic masculinity,
the rebirth of hegemonic masculinity through war. Relies too much on
Mary Daly for my comfort. Similar to *Masculinity and New War*,
(Duriesmith).

nodes.title: Healing from Hate: How Young Men Get Into – And Out Of – Violent Extremism
nodes.content: <!-- Professor of sociology and gender studies, Michael Kimmel ... -->

nodes.title: Male Fantasies
nodes.content: Sociologist, Klaus Theweleit psychoanalyses Freikorps pulp fiction.

nodes.title: This Is Why We Can't Have Nice Things: Mapping the Relationship between Online Trolling and Mainstream Culture
nodes.content: <!-- Media studies scholar and author Whitney Phillips ... -->

nodes.title: That's Not Funny: How the Right Makes Comedy Work for Them
Fandom Unbound: Otaku Culture in a Connected World
nodes.content:
Uses the book *Train Man* as a jumping off point for discussing
cynicism, irony and romanticism in 2channel and Japanese nationalism.

nodes.title: Internet Histories
Contemporary Japan
The Tender Cut: Inside the Hidden World of Self-Injury
nodes.content:
Ethnographers, Peter Adler and Patricia Adler study internet
communities of self-injurers.  The profile of protest masculinities
may overlap with self-injurers when protest masculinity becomes a form
of self-harm.

nodes.title: Understanding and Countering Fascist Movements: From Void to Hope
nodes.content:
Particularly, look into chapter 4 "Limitations of the 'Countering
Extremism' Model" which gathers together a lot of good criticisms of
the counter-extremism industry.

nodes.title: For Your Own Good:  Hidden Cruelty in Child-Rearing and the Roots of Violence
The Violence Project: How to Stop a Mass Shooting Epidemic
nodes.content:
Psychologist and sociologist team, Dr. Jillian Peterson and Dr. James
Densley provide a life history study of American mass shooters.  *The
Violence Project* is a better work than most of its type, but is
mostly focused on observing, and disempowering potential shooters.

nodes.title: The Mass Psychology of Fascism
nodes.content:
Psychoanalyst, Wilhelm Reich posits the origin of fascism in libidinal
repression.

nodes.title: Anti-Semite and Jew
The Authoritarians
nodes.content:
Psychologist, Bob Altemeyer summarizes his research on the psychology
of "right-wing authoritarians" and "social dominants."

See for access [theauthoritarians.org/options-for-getting-the-book](https://theauthoritarians.org/options-for-getting-the-book).

nodes.title: The Authoritarian Dynamic
nodes.content:
Political scientist, Karen Stenner posits an "authoritarian
predisposition" underlying contemporary measures of authoritarianism.
Unfortunately, *The Authoritarian Dynamic* comes across as very saneist
in parts.

nodes.title: Sexual Myths of Modernity: Sadism, Masochism, and Historical Teleology
nodes.content: Pushes back against the idea that fascism is rooted in some kind of sexual pathology.

nodes.title: Nova Religio
W(h)ither the Christian Right?
Against the Modern World: Traditionalism and the Secret Intellectual History of the Twentieth Century
nodes.content: Bleh, I've read a bit more than half of this but I still need to finish this up.

nodes.title: Neo-Nazi Terrorism and Countercultural Fascism: The Origins and Afterlife of James Mason’s Siege
The Colonizer and the Colonized
nodes.content: Fantastic book on the dynamics of colonization.

nodes.title: Our Enemies in Blue: Police and Power in America
nodes.content:
American anarchist author, Kristian Williams discusses the origins of
North-American policing in slavery.

nodes.title: In the Shadow of Diagnosis: Psychiatric Power and Queer Life
Theory, Culture & Society
Black Skin, White Masks
nodes.content: Very relatable to any minority but not really about whiteness

nodes.title: Black on White: Black Writers on What It Means to Be White
"Beyond the Pale": Tainted Whiteness, Cognitive Disability, and Eugenic Sterilization
Learning to be White: Money, Race and God in America
Not Gay: Sex Between Straight White Men
nodes.content: Comes off as unsympathetic but describes a real thing.

nodes.title: Women of the Klan: Racism and Gender in the 1920s
Inside Organized Racism: Women in the Hate Movement
nodes.content: Professor of sociology, Kathleen M. Blee studies women in hate groups.

nodes.title: Why Would Feminists Trust the Police?: A tangled history of resistance and complicity
Right-Wing Women: The Politics of Domesticated Females
Feminist Review
nodes.content:
bell hooks asserts a number of ways mainstream feminism or "white
feminism" fails black people and the working-class.  Such failures of
feminism towards the marginalized, problematize feminist study and
activism in the area of internet protest masculinities.

nodes.title: Feminist Media Studies
Against White Feminism: Notes on Disruption
Motherboard: Tech by Vice
nodes.content: <!-- http://web.archive.org/web/20201102144444/https://www.vice.com/en/article/m7aap8/the-man-who-helped-turn-4chan-into-the-internets-racist-engine -->

nodes.title: Antisocial: Online Extremists, Techno-Utopians, and the Hijacking of the American Conversation
nodes.content:
New Yorker staff writer, Andrew Marentz chronicles the rise of the
alt-right from the perspective of social-media influencers.

nodes.title: Information, Communication & Society
Men Who Hate Women: From Incels to Pickup Artist: The Truth about Extreme Misogyny and How it Affects Us All
nodes.content:
Women's rights activist, Laura Bates investigates the emerging network
of masculinist internet movements.

nodes.title: It Came From Something Awful: How a Toxic Troll Army Accidentally Memed Donald Trump Into Office
nodes.content:
Writer and artist, Dale Beran gives an inside account of 4chan's
evolution from meme machine to hate machine.

nodes.title: Gamergate and Anti-Feminism in the Digital Age
Meme Wars: the Untold Story of the Online Battles Upending Democracy in America
Post-Digital Cultures of the Far Right: Online Actions and Offline Consequences in Europe and the US
Convergence
Crash Override: How Gamergate (nearly) Destroyed My Life, and How We Can Win the Fight Against Online Hate
I Could Not Be Hindu: The Story of a Dalit in the RSS
nodes.content: Dalit man born 1975 in India enters and exits the far-right organization Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh.

nodes.title: White American Youth: My Descent into America's Most Violent Hate Movement – and How I Got Out
nodes.content: Man born 1973 in Blue Island, U.S. enters and exits neo-Nazism.

nodes.title: Rising Out of Hatred: The Awakening of a Former White Nationalist
nodes.content:
Roland Derek Black, born 1989 in West Palm Beach, U.S. is born into White
Nationalism, publicly exits shortly after college.

nodes.title: The Klansman's Son: My Journey From White Nationalism to Antiracism: A Memoir
nodes.content:
Derek Black, transgender nonbinary woman, born 1989 in West Palm Beach, U.S., is born into White
Nationalism, publicly exits shortly after college.

nodes.title: Hate: My Life in the British Far Right
nodes.content: Man born 1972 in London, Britain enters and exits far-right.

nodes.title: Führer Ex: Memoirs of a Former Neo-Nazi
nodes.content: Man born 1967 in East Berlin, East Germany enters and exits neo-Nazism.

nodes.title: Walking Away from Hate: Our Journey through Extremism
nodes.content: Bisexual woman born 1990 in Toronto, Canada enters and exits neo-Nazism.

nodes.title: The Cure for Hate: A Former White Supremacist’s Journey from Violent Extremism to Radical Compassion
nodes.content: Man born 1967 in Vancouver, Canada enters and exits neo-Nazism.

nodes.title: Autobiography of a Recovering Skinhead: The Frank Meeink Story as Told to Jody M. Roy, Ph. D.
nodes.content: Man born 1975 in South Philadelphia, U.S. enters and exits neo-Nazism, struggles with drug use.

nodes.title: Going to Meet the Man
The Stranger
nodes.content: An existentialist classic tackling themes of alienation and nihilism.

nodes.title: Emesis Blue
nodes.content:
Critically acclaimed TF2 SFM horror movie.  Comments on internet
culture and bricolage.

nodes.title: a prison, a body
nodes.content:
An NSFW exploration of trans\* maladjustment and bondage.  Comments on
trans\* internet porn.

nodes.title: The Sisters of Dorley
nodes.content: Comments on trans\* internet erotica.

nodes.title: Kalevala
nodes.content: Comments on childhood trauma and adult dysfunction.

nodes.title: My Lesbian Experience with Loneliness
nodes.content: Kabi Nagata explores her personal struggle with alienation.

nodes.title: She-Ra and the Princesses of Power
nodes.content: Comments on repression and the cycle of abuse.

nodes.title: To Own the Libs
nodes.content: Comments on "spiky eggs."

nodes.title: Tetsuo: The Iron Man
A Clockwork Orange
American Psycho
American History X
Crime and Punishment
Fight Club
Gayniggers from Outer Space
Joker
K-On!
Mage: The Ascension
nodes.content:
Tabletop role-playing game based around pseudo-gnostic ideas of
manipulating and seeing beyond consensus reality.

nodes.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
Neon Genesis Evangelion
Pink Flamingos
Puella Magi Madoka Magica
Shrek
Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith
Supergods: What Masked Vigilantes, Miraculous Mutants, and a Sun God from Smallville Can Teach Us About Being Human
nodes.content:
Related to metafiction and memes.
Can be (mis)interpreted as advocating for a kind of metafictional palingenetic masculinity.

nodes.title: Taxi Driver
The Dark Knight Rises
The Invisibles
The Matrix
nodes.content:
From *The Matrix*, derives the metaphor of the redpill, meaning an
unpleasant truth, popular among internet protest masculinities.

nodes.title: They Live
The Fellowship of the Ring: Being the First Part of The Lord of the Rings
The Two Towers: Being the Second Part of The Lord of the Rings
The Return of the King: Being the Third Part of The Lord of the Rings
Xavier: Renegade Angel
Jennyffer
nodes.content: Amanda Avila spoofs transgender imageboard culture.

nodes.title: Train Main: The Novel
The Turner Diaries
Mind
nodes.content:
Surviving Sophist text with Skeptic similarities.  Mostly, a series of
arguments that two things are the same and then that these things are
different.

nodes.title: Marfarka the Futurist: An African Novel
nodes.content: Bizarre and disturbing proto-fascist novel.

nodes.title: The Power of Positive Thinking
nodes.content:
Toxic positivity self-help book. Peale's religious teachings greatly
influenced Donald Trump. Frighteningly callous and terrible advice.

nodes.title: A Normie's Guide to the Alt-Right
nodes.content: See the Internet Archive link [web.archive.org/web/20231210135756/https://dailystormer.in/a-normies-guide-to-the-alt-right](https://web.archive.org/web/20231210135756/https://dailystormer.in/a-normies-guide-to-the-alt-right).

nodes.title: Revolt Against the Modern World
Dissecting the (Autistic) Manosphere | A Neurodiverse Commentary on F.D Signifier
Always Disabled: Navigating Grief over a Lost Childhood
Laziness Does Not Exist: a Defense of the Exhausted, Exploited, and Overworked
Unmasking Autism: Discovering the New Faces of Neurodiversity
Combating Cult Mind Control: The Guide to Protection, Rescue and Recovery from Destructive Cults
Conspirituality: How New Age Conspiracy Theories Became a Public Health Threat
Worst Year Ever
nodes.content: Far-right entryism and resistance in the furry fandom.

nodes.title: Worst Year Ever
The Daily Former
What no title?
Global Vocies
Vice News
That Dang Dad
82: TRANSmaxxing w/ Nixie (@ManicPixJeepGrl)
Breaking Hate: Confronting the New Culture of Violent Extremism
Pray Away
Reclaiming Trans
The Will to Change: Men, Masculinity, and Love
The Velvet Rage: Overcoming the Pain of Growing Up Gay in a Straight Man's World
nodes.content:
Clinical psychologist, Alan Downs discusses his work with self-hating
gay men in his practice.

nodes.title: Why Does he do That?
The Anxiety and Phobia Workbook
Adult Children of Emotionally Immature Parents: How to Heal from Distant, Rejecting, or Self-Involved Parents
nodes.content: Unfortunately, it is common for people who get involved in groups to be survivors of child abuse.

nodes.title: Mindfulness in Plain English
Organizing Solutions for People with ADHD: Tips and Tools to Help You Take Charge of Your Life and Get Organized
Brain Lock: Free Yourself from Obsessive-Compulsive Behavior: a Four-step Self-treatment Method to Change Your Brain Chemistry
Learned Optimism: How to Change Your Mind and Your Life
Instinctive sleeping and resting postures: an anthropological and zoological approach to treatment of low back and joint pain
Trans/Rad/Fem
Jennifer Coates
Nerds, Catgirls, and Other Trans Potentialities
nodes.content: Discusses self-hatred, gay internet nerds.

nodes.title: Tricky Mother Nature
Libcom's organising toolkit
nodes.content: British based but still interesting.

nodes.title: Some Actions that are Not Protesting or Voting
Evolve Program
nodes.content:
Edmonton based support service for those moving away from ideologies,
conspiracy theories, grievances or groups that justify violence.

nodes.title: Life After Hate
Shift BC
